00029 Simple_store_sz<Env_dir::Size> Ns_base_dir::store __attribute__((init_priority(1000)));
00030 
00031 void *
00032 Ns_base_dir::operator new(size_t s) throw()
00033 {
00034   if (s > Size)
00035     return 0;
00036 
00037   return store.alloc();
00038 }
00039 
00040 void
00041 Ns_base_dir::operator delete(void *b) throw()
00042 {
00043   store.free(b);
00044 }

00047 int
00048 Ns_dir::get_ds(const char *path, L4Re::Auto_cap<L4Re::Dataspace>::Cap *ds) throw()
00049 {
00050   L4Re::Auto_cap<L4Re::Dataspace>::Cap file(cap_alloc()->alloc<L4Re::Dataspace>(), cap_alloc());
00051 
00052   if (!file.is_valid())
00053     return -ENOMEM;
00054 
00055   int err = _ns->query(path, file.get());
00056 
00057   if (err < 0)
00058     return -ENOENT;
00059 
00060   *ds = file;
00061   return err;
00062 }
00063 
00064 int
00065 Ns_dir::get_entry(const char *path, int flags, mode_t mode,
00066                   Ref_ptr<L4Re::Vfs::File> *f) throw()
00067 {
00068   (void)mode; (void)flags;
00069   if (!*path)
00070     {
00071       *f = this;
00072       return 0;
00073     }
00074 
00075   L4Re::Auto_cap<Dataspace>::Cap file;
00076   int err = get_ds(path, &file);
00077 
00078   if (err < 0)
00079     return -ENOENT;
00080 
00081   // FIXME: should check if it is a dataspace, somehow
00082   L4Re::Vfs::File *fi = 0;
00083 
00084   L4::Cap<L4Re::Namespace> nsc
00085     = L4::cap_dynamic_cast<L4Re::Namespace>(file.get());
00086 
00087   if (!nsc.is_valid())
00088     fi = new Ro_file(file.get());
00089   else // use mat protocol here!!
00090     fi = new Ns_dir(nsc);
00091 
00092   if (!fi)
00093     return -ENOMEM;
00094 
00095   file.release();
00096   *f = fi;
00097   return 0;
00098 }
00099 
00100 int
00101 Ns_dir::faccessat(const char *path, int mode, int flags) throw()
00102 {
00103   (void)flags;
00104   L4Re::Auto_cap<void>::Cap tmpcap(cap_alloc()->alloc<void>(), cap_alloc());
00105 
00106   if (!tmpcap.is_valid())
00107     return -ENOMEM;
00108 
00109   if (_ns->query(path, tmpcap.get()))
00110     return -ENOENT;
00111 
00112   if (mode & W_OK)
00113     return -EACCES;
00114 
00115   return 0;
00116 }

00118 int
00119 Ns_dir::fstat64(struct stat64 *b) const throw()
00120 {
00121   b->st_dev = 1;
00122   b->st_ino = 1;
00123   b->st_mode = S_IRWXU | S_IFDIR;
00124   b->st_nlink = 0;
00125   b->st_uid = 0;
00126   b->st_gid = 0;
00127   b->st_rdev = 0;
00128   b->st_size = 0;
00129   b->st_blksize = 0;
00130   b->st_blocks = 0;
00131   b->st_atime = 0;
00132   b->st_mtime = 0;
00133   b->st_ctime = 0;
00134   return 0;
00135 }
00136 
00137 ssize_t
00138 Ns_dir::getdents(char *buf, size_t sz) throw()
00139 {
00140   struct dirent64 *d = (struct dirent64 *)buf;
00141   ssize_t ret = 0;
00142   l4_addr_t infoaddr;
00143   size_t infosz;
00144 
00145   L4Re::Auto_cap<Dataspace>::Cap dirinfofile;
00146   int err = get_ds(".dirinfo", &dirinfofile);
00147   if (err)
00148     return 0;
00149 
00150   infosz = dirinfofile->size();
00151   if (infosz <= 0)
00152     return 0;
00153 
00154   infoaddr = L4_PAGESIZE;
00155   err = L4Re::Env::env()->rm()->attach(&infoaddr, infosz,
00156                                        Rm::Search_addr | Rm::Read_only,
00157                                        dirinfofile.get(), 0);
00158   char *p   = (char *)infoaddr + _current_dir_pos;
00159   char *end = (char *)infoaddr + infosz;
00160 
00161   while (d && p < end)
00162     {
00163       // parse lines of dirinfofile
00164       long len;
00165       for (len = 0; p < end && *p >= '0' && *p <= '9'; ++p)
00166         {
00167           len *= 10;
00168           len += *p - '0';
00169         }
00170       if (len)
00171         {
00172           // skip colon
00173           p++;
00174           if (p + len >= end)
00175             return 0; // error in dirinfofile
00176 
00177           unsigned l = len + 1;
00178           if (l > sizeof(d->d_name))
00179             l = sizeof(d->d_name);
00180 
00181           unsigned n = offsetof (struct dirent64, d_name) + l;
00182           n = (n + sizeof(long) - 1) & ~(sizeof(long) - 1);
00183 
00184           if (n > sz)
00185             break;
00186 
00187           d->d_ino = 1;
00188           d->d_off = 0;
00189           memcpy(d->d_name, p, len);
00190           d->d_name[l - 1] = 0;
00191           d->d_reclen = n;
00192           d->d_type   = DT_REG;
00193           ret += n;
00194           sz  -= n;
00195           d    = (struct dirent64 *)((unsigned long)d + n);
00196         }
00197 
00198       // next infodirfile line
00199       while (p < end && *p && *p != '\n' && *p != '\r')
00200         p++;
00201       while (p < end && *p && (*p == '\n' || *p == '\r'))
00202         p++;
00203     }
00204 
00205   _current_dir_pos += p - (char *)infoaddr;
00206 
00207   if (!ret) // hack since we should only reset this at open times
00208     _current_dir_pos = 0;
00209 
00210   L4Re::Env::env()->rm()->detach(infoaddr, 0);
00211 
00212   return ret;
00213 }
00214 
00215 int
00216 Env_dir::get_ds(const char *path, L4Re::Auto_cap<L4Re::Dataspace>::Cap *ds) throw()
00217 {
00218   Vfs::Path p(path);
00219   Vfs::Path first = p.strip_first();
00220 
00221   if (first.empty())
00222     return -ENOENT;
00223 
00224   L4::Cap<L4Re::Namespace>
00225     c = _env->get_cap<L4Re::Namespace>(first.path(), first.length());
00226 
00227   if (!c.is_valid())
00228     return -ENOENT;
00229 
00230   if (p.empty())
00231     {
00232       *ds = L4Re::Auto_cap<L4Re::Dataspace>::Cap(L4::cap_reinterpret_cast<L4Re::Dataspace>(c));
00233       return 0;
00234     }
00235 
00236   L4Re::Auto_cap<L4Re::Dataspace>::Cap file(cap_alloc()->alloc<L4Re::Dataspace>(), cap_alloc());
00237 
00238   if (!file.is_valid())
00239     return -ENOMEM;
00240 
00241   int err = c->query(p.path(), p.length(), file.get());
00242 
00243   if (err < 0)
00244     return -ENOENT;
00245 
00246   *ds = file;
00247   return err;
00248 }
00249 
00250 int
00251 Env_dir::get_entry(const char *path, int flags, mode_t mode,
00252                    Ref_ptr<L4Re::Vfs::File> *f) throw()
00253 {
00254   (void)mode; (void)flags;
00255   if (!*path)
00256     {
00257       *f = this;
00258       return 0;
00259     }
00260 
00261   L4Re::Auto_cap<Dataspace>::Cap file;
00262   int err = get_ds(path, &file);
00263 
00264   if (err < 0)
00265     return -ENOENT;
00266 
00267   // FIXME: should check if it is a dataspace, somehow
00268   L4Re::Vfs::File *fi = 0;
00269 
00270   L4::Cap<L4Re::Namespace> nsc
00271     = L4::cap_dynamic_cast<L4Re::Namespace>(file.get());
00272 
00273   if (!nsc.is_valid())
00274     fi = new Ro_file(file.get());
00275   else // use mat protocol here!!
00276     fi = new Ns_dir(nsc);
00277 
00278   if (!fi)
00279     return -ENOMEM;
00280 
00281   file.release();
00282   *f = fi;
00283   return 0;
00284 }
00285 
00286 int
00287 Env_dir::faccessat(const char *path, int mode, int flags) throw()
00288 {
00289   (void)flags;
00290   Vfs::Path p(path);
00291   Vfs::Path first = p.strip_first();
00292 
00293   if (first.empty())
00294     return -ENOENT;
00295 
00296   L4::Cap<L4Re::Namespace>
00297     c = _env->get_cap<L4Re::Namespace>(first.path(), first.length());
00298 
00299   if (!c.is_valid())
00300     return -ENOENT;
00301 
00302   if (p.empty())
00303     {
00304       if (mode & W_OK)
00305   return -EACCES;
00306 
00307       return 0;
00308     }
00309 
00310   L4Re::Auto_cap<void>::Cap tmpcap(cap_alloc()->alloc<void>(), cap_alloc());
00311 
00312   if (!tmpcap.is_valid())
00313     return -ENOMEM;
00314 
00315   if (c->query(p.path(), p.length(), tmpcap.get()))
00316     return -ENOENT;
00317 
00318   if (mode & W_OK)
00319     return -EACCES;
00320 
00321   return 0;
00322 }
00323 
00324 bool
00325 Env_dir::check_type(Env::Cap_entry const *e, long protocol)
00326 {
00327   L4::Cap<L4::Meta> m(e->cap);
00328   return m->supports(protocol).label();
00329 }
00330 
00331 int
00332 Env_dir::fstat64(struct stat64 *b) const throw()
00333 {
00334   b->st_dev = 1;
00335   b->st_ino = 1;
00336   b->st_mode = S_IRWXU | S_IFDIR;
00337   b->st_nlink = 0;
00338   b->st_uid = 0;
00339   b->st_gid = 0;
00340   b->st_rdev = 0;
00341   b->st_size = 0;
00342   b->st_blksize = 0;
00343   b->st_blocks = 0;
00344   b->st_atime = 0;
00345   b->st_mtime = 0;
00346   b->st_ctime = 0;
00347   return 0;
00348 }
00349 
00350 ssize_t
00351 Env_dir::getdents(char *buf, size_t sz) throw()
00352 {
00353   struct dirent64 *d = (struct dirent64 *)buf;
00354   ssize_t ret = 0;
00355 
00356   while (d
00357          && _current_cap_entry
00358          && _current_cap_entry->flags != ~0UL)
00359     {
00360       unsigned l = strlen(_current_cap_entry->name) + 1;
00361       if (l > sizeof(d->d_name))
00362         l = sizeof(d->d_name);
00363 
00364       unsigned n = offsetof (struct dirent64, d_name) + l;
00365       n = (n + sizeof(long) - 1) & ~(sizeof(long) - 1);
00366 
00367       if (n <= sz)
00368         {
00369           d->d_ino = 1;
00370           d->d_off = 0;
00371           memcpy(d->d_name, _current_cap_entry->name, l);
00372           d->d_name[l - 1] = 0;
00373           d->d_reclen = n;
00374           if (check_type(_current_cap_entry, L4Re::Protocol::Namespace))
00375             d->d_type = DT_DIR;
00376           else if (check_type(_current_cap_entry, L4Re::Protocol::Dataspace))
00377             d->d_type = DT_REG;
00378           else
00379             d->d_type = DT_UNKNOWN;
00380           ret += n;
00381           sz  -= n;
00382           d    = (struct dirent64 *)((unsigned long)d + n);
00383           _current_cap_entry++;
00384         }
00385       else
00386         return ret;
00387     }
00388 
00389   // bit of a hack because we should only (re)set this when opening the dir
00390   if (!ret)
00391     _current_cap_entry = _env->initial_caps();
00392 
00393   return ret;
00394 }
